page.title: 12BONFIRE NIGHT IN LEWES
page.content: The{Borough}Bonfire Society consists of 150 to 200 people and 1 to 2 bands. It has been going since 1853 .The most exciting {Bonfire Night}for the{ {Borough}was probably the Queens Silver Jubilee when the{Borough}lit the first {Bonfire}.In the 1960s{Bonfire Night} was cancelled because of floods.The costumes were not chosen because everyone wanted the same one but one person chose a costume and others copied.In 1947 the{Borough}said the{ {Bonfire Night}prayers under the Houses of Parliament. The societies are the Borough ,{Commercial Square , Waterloo {, South Street ,Cliffe}and{Nevill.}In the "Grand United" there are between 1000 and 1200 people and about eight bands,{Cliffe and Nevill}are not included in the "Grand United." By Ben T, Max T, Stephen P, Mark F.
